alert.note: Alert for Northeast Mountains; Spokane Area; Upper Columbia Basin (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 10 at 12:17PM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...Thunderstorms will impact portions of north central Whitman, east central Lincoln, southeastern Stevens, Spokane and south central Pend Oreille Counties through 1245 PM PDT... At 1216 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 12 miles west of Deer Park to 15 miles southeast of Cheney. Movement was northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Spokane, Spokane Valley, Cheney, Liberty Lake, Airway Heights, Medical Lake, Nine Mile Falls, Deer Park, Millwood, Fairwood, Suncrest, Fairchild AFB, Dishman, Green Acres, Trentwood, Country Homes, Town And Country, Chattaroy, Mead, and Otis Orchards-East Farms. This includes the following highways... Interstate 90 in Washington between mile markers 259 and 297. U.S. Highway 2 in Washington between mile markers 262 and 321. U.S. Highway 195 in Washington between mile markers 64 and 95. U.S. Highway 395 in Washington between mile markers 165 and 196. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Northeast Mountains; Spokane Area; Upper Columbia Basin
